content: The "Certified Development Company Enhancement and Improvement Act of 1997" authorizes program levels for Small Business Act and Small Business Investment Act financing for fiscal years 1998-2000. The "Certified Development Company Enhancement and Improvement Act of 1997" authorizes program levels for Small Business Act and Small Business Investment Act financing for fiscal years 1998-2000. Amendments include fee assessments for borrowers, such as adjusting the fee amount annually to reduce costs to zero and changing the fee percentage from 15 to not more than 50 basis points. Section 508(b)(2) of the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 is amended to require that a certified development company must be active in the accredited lenders program and have a history of submitting properly analyzed debenture guarantee applications. Section 508(c) of the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 is amended to require premier certified lenders to establish a loss reserve equal to 10% of their exposure for approved financings. The reserve can be comprised of segregated funds in federally insured depository accounts. The company must contribute to the loss reserve with cash or letters of credit in specified amounts and intervals. The Small Business Investment Act of 1958 is amended to include provisions for replenishing the loss reserve and allowing certified development companies to withdraw from the reserve for repaid debentures. Additionally, companies are required to contribute cash or letters of credit to the loss reserve at specified intervals. Section 508 of the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 is amended to include program goals for certified development companies participating in the premier certified lender program. Amendments also address the effect of suspension or revocation and redesignate subsections for clarity. Sec. 10. Section 508(i) of the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 is amended to require the Administration to promulgate regulations within 90 days and issue program guidelines within 120 days. Sec. 11 amends Section 508(j) by specifying a comparison of default and recovery rates for lenders. Sec. 12 repeals Section 217(b) of Public Law 103-403. Sec. 13 amends Section 508(d) by removing the authority to approve loans. Sec. 14 amends the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 to specify the use of loan proceeds for small businesses. Sec. 15 allows up to 25% of a project to be leased by a small business, with certain conditions. The Small Business Investment Act of 1958 requires small businesses to occupy at least 55% of project space. Seller financing can be used to meet certain requirements, and collateral provided by the small business concern must be valued. The Small Business Investment Act of 1958 mandates that small businesses occupy 55% of project space. Seller financing can help meet requirements, and collateral from the small business must be valued based on willing buyer and seller agreement.
